Adam Jack wrote:

>> 	If your project has a big problem with core classes failing on a
>> 	regular basis, then maybe you have a process/people problem, as
> opposed to a
> technical problem.
> 
> So junit is for folks who don't really need good testing? ;-)

Adam, I don't fully understand your intent here, but your sentence does
feel overly rude to me. The smiley really doesn't change much.

It seems obvious to me that J.B. *very much* cares about good testing -
and about your concerns, even if he disagrees; else he wouldn't discuss
the issues at such length with you. I also think that the whole xJunit
community has done very much for the better regarding unit testing - it
doesn't deserve such comments.

But perhaps I am overreacting because I strongly feel as part of the
community you attacked with above sentence. I also don't understand at
all how it connects to J.B.'s suggestion (which I think probably isn't
totally misguided). Would you like to elaborate?

Regards, Ilja
